title.narrative: (2012-4)CAPACITY FOR ACSD SERVICE PROVIS

description.narrative: (2012-2014) By 2016, 13 health prefectures have the necessary capacity to implement the high impact package of services., which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, at least 60% of girls and boys under-five and pregnant / lactating women use high impact gender-responsive integrated services (curative, preventive and promotional) in the country for an accelerated reduction of infant and under five mortality and maternal mortality.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: (2012-2014) By 2016, 13 health prefectures have the necessary capacity to implement the high impact package of services.
health prefectures with revamped PHC management committees
of health prefetures without shortages of essential commodities for high impact services / care
of health prefectures monitoring interventions quarterly
of prefecture's health teams trained in planning and management of integrated high impact interventions
